      • getFormat

        public int getFormat()
        Description copied from interface: IBitmap
        Returns the color format of this bitmap.

        This can be one of the included formats (ex. IBitmap.FORMAT_RGBA_8888), or a completely different one.

        Specified by:
        getFormat in interface IBitmap
        Returns:
        A flag indicating the format.

      • getData

        public ByteBuffer getData()
        Description copied from interface: IBitmap
        Returns the bitmap data.

        Note that while some implementations may return the backing buffer directly, others may allocate a new one for each bitmap, or even for each call. Therefore prefer using IBitmap.getData(ByteBuffer).

        Specified by:
        getData in interface IBitmap
        Returns:
        A buffer containing the bitmap data.
        See Also:
        IBitmap.getData(ByteBuffer)

      • getData

        public void getData(ByteBuffer buffer)
        Description copied from interface: IBitmap
        Copies the bitmap data into the given buffer.

        The buffer's position will be incremented by the number of bytes written.

        Specified by:
        getData in interface IBitmap
        See Also:
        IBitmap.getByteCount()

      • getByteCount

        public int getByteCount()
        Description copied from interface: IBitmap
        Returns the number of bytes this bitmap's data uses.

        This is also the minimum capacity a buffer needs to contain the data.

        Specified by:
        getByteCount in interface IBitmap
        Returns:
        The data byte count of this bitmap.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Description copied from interface: IDisposable
        Releases resources used by this object and marks it as disposed.

        The object should not be used after this.

        Specified by:
        dispose in interface IDisposable
